meanings.definition: To write or publish a brief endorsement or summary of a book, movie, etc.
meanings.sent1: She blurbed the new movie on her blog.
meanings.sent2: The author blurbed the upcoming book release.
meanings.sent3: He blurbed the movie in just three words: 'A must-watch!'
meanings.sent4: The critic blurbed the film as a cinematic masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: Blurbing the novel made it an instant bestseller.

meanings.definition: A brief endorsement or summary of a book, movie, etc.
meanings.sent1: The blurbed review convinced her to watch the film.
meanings.sent2: The book cover featured a glowing blurb from a famous author.
meanings.sent3: The blurbed description of the movie was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: She always reads the blurbs on books before deciding to buy them.
meanings.sent5: The blurbed summary captured the essence of the story perfectly.
